page.title: 02FENSTANTON
page.content: {Fenstanton,}set on the old Roman road (A6O4),has a population of 2,500.The village goes back before Domesday when it had a population of 32.In those days it was owned by the Bishop of Rochester.After Domesday it was owned by Gilbert of Gaunt,a nephew of William the Conquerer. {The oldest part of the village is {Honey Hill;}the church and the clock tower are nearly as old.{The church {spire}has been a village landmark for over 600 years.{The clocktower}in the High Street has a bell that was put there in 1660,that makes it over 300 years old. {Today Fenstanton is a busy village and has lots of shops and buildings including Post Office,Nursery,Frock Exchange,Baker's,Butcher's etc. I think Fenstanton has a stable future and will flourish ever more.
